title: Underflow with torch.rand()?
body_html:
Hi all, I am trying to use torch.rand() to implement Gumbel softmax, when I encountered a runtime error traced back to torch.rand(). It should generate random numbers from [0,1), but sometimes a very large number (e.g., 1069886848.0) occurs and my program crashes.

Here is how I used it:

def sample_gumbel(shape, eps=1e-10):
    U = torch.rand(*shape) * (1-eps)
    return -torch.log(-torch.log(U + eps) + eps)

I have also attached the problematic U. You can load it with pickle.
U_problem.pkl.zip

Any suggestions?
